B-Links

  • CSS Text Effects - A Collection, by Mandy Michael, of impressive CSS text Effects
  • 12 Factor CLI Apps - Useful tips for creating CLI commands
  • Teach, Don't Tell - A fantastic, lengthy post on good documentation.
  • Bulma - A modern CSS framework based on Flexbox. Looks good
  • GramTest: A tool for Grammar based Test case generation
  • Event Sourcing: Eventual Consistency and Responding to Events - The 3rd part in an excellent series on Event Sourcing.
  • The Dark Standup - Great idea
  • Let’s Stop Ascribing Meaning to Code Points - They are NOT characters. Do NOT treat them as such.
  • Performant Parallaxing - Non-JS, smooth parallax scrolling.
  • Use the Unofficial Bash Strict Mode - Good advice for using Bash

Happenings

RSS

You might have noticed a tiny xml button appear on the navigation bar. Those in the know will, well, know that it’s an RSS button. The front page of this site is now available in the RSS format for those that have aggregators. Don’t say I’m not good to you.

Omlette

When making omlettes ensure the following:

  • Use enough eggs,
  • Make sure the oil is heated properly,
  • Don’t attempt to use a technique that you only half saw a professional chef use to make it,
  • and, importantly, know how to cook.

The end result was… interesting.

Anticipointment

Sometimes new words are great:

Anticipointment
What viewers experience when you fall short of their expectations after over-promoting a story or show.

While I might not use it in the context of television, I can see it being added to my vocabularly.

Via Tantek

Down Time

I tried to update this site today, but to no avail. It seems that my hosts are down again. I don’t mind the odd bit of downtime, I really don’t, but this is the second time in as many weeks. I need to find a new host.

Anyway, today’s updates will be made offline and then uploaded at a later date. Such are the benefits of having a robust, database-free CMS offline: synchronising is cheap and easy (most modern FTP clients can do this for you), server downtime doesn’t limit productivity, and you have somewhere to rant.

It should also be mentioned that the local copy of my CMS, Finetto, is more advanced than the online copy since it has all the latest updates I’m making.

Another Node

So, since the site is in it’s infancy, I need to link to the weblogging community in a general way for now. I joined a webring (see the navigation bar to the right): Scottish Blogs. Seems like I can’t keep away from connecting the wired world to the real world. This isn’t a real update, more of a notification.
